node.title: Crucial Hooper try disallowed, as Wallabies bow to Scotland late
node.description: Finn Russell slotted a penalty to put the Scots ahead with 10 minutes remaining.
node.content: ["Replacement hooker Ewan Ashman has scored a try on his debut, as Scotland won the forward contest to defeat Australia 15-13 in a feisty autumn international clash at Murrayfield.", "Loose forward Hamish Watson also crossed for a try, and flyhalf Finn Russell slotted one penalty and a conversion, as the Scots kept up their winning run against Australia with a third successive victory.", "Australia, who were beaten at the breakdown and the scrum, managed a single try through loose forward Rob Leota, as prop Allan Alaalatoa also received a contested yellow card.", "Russell landed the winning penalty after 69 minutes, as the visitors were penalised at the scrum yet again, much to the delight of the home fans.", "\"We had to dig deep,\" says Man of the Match Watson. \"Australia are a class side - the in-form team in world rugby - so we knew we'd have to work really hard.\u00a0", "\"Something special is building here. It was a nervy last 10 minutes on the bench, but the fans got us through.", "\"To have 67,000 back at Murrayfield is absolutely amazing. We've waited a long time for this, a really special day.\"", "Scotland lost injured hooker George Turner after 11 minutes, providing replacement Ashman with almost a full game.", "After a frenetic opening in which both sides got into their opponent's 22, but came away empty-handed, Scotland grabbed the first points, with a well-worked try by Watson from a five-metre attacking lineout.", "Australia expected the driving maul, but the ball was transferred quickly to lock Grant Gilchrist, who was pushed almost unopposed towards the line by two teammates and Watson was able to finish the move.", "Australia thought they had scored in reply, when captain Michael Hooper crossed, but Alaalatoa was adjudged to have connected with the head of Scotland's Matt Fagerson, as he tried to clean out the ruck.\n", "Television match official Marius Jonker was convinced there was foul play, much to the dismay of Hooper.", "\"You can't be serious, I can't believe that,\"\u00a0Hooper told French referee Romain Poite, who was officiating his final test. \"He didn't do anything.\"\u00a0", "Alaalatoa was sent to the sin-bin, as the home side led 7-3 at halftime.", "Leota barged his way over to score a try for Australia, after running an excellent line from scrumhalf Nic White's pass, as the visitors moved into the lead for the first time.", "But Ashman's dream debut was capped with a superb score in the corner, as he contorted his body to dot the ball down under pressure from the Wallabies defence.", "Australia regained the advantage when James O'Connor landed a penalty, after the home side were adjudged to have infringed at the breakdown.", "But the visitors' problems at the scrum throughout the game cost them again, when Russell edged the Scots ahead with a penalty, after Alaalatoa lost his bind.", "\"It was a tough one, tit-for-tat for a while and we weren't really able to gather momentum,\" Hooper says. \"It was very stop-start.", "\"Scotland played well to deny us the ball, and we weren't able to recycle it and do some of the things we wanted.", "\"We poked our noses in front, but couldn't stay down their end of the field through our (poor) discipline and their ability to put pressure on our ball.\"\u00a0", "Reuters"]
